title: An Analysis On Campaign Events By Morgan Miller
description: Kamala Harris visits on the 2020 campaign trail.
contents:
Below find my analysis on the visits per month by Kamala Harris on the presidential campaign trail in 2020.
I began with a layout of all visits by each candidate in the 2020 primaries.

# A tibble: 6 x 7
  date       cand_restname cand_lastname city      state event_type
  <date>     <chr>         <chr>         <chr>     <chr> <chr>     
1 2019-08-31 Julian        Castro        Houston   TX    forum     
2 2019-08-31 Bernie        Sanders       Houston   TX    forum     
3 2019-08-28 Joe           Biden         Charlotte NC    TBD       
4 2019-08-25 Elizabeth     Warren        Seattle   WA    town hall 
5 2019-08-25 Bill          de Blasio     New York  NY    town hall 
6 2019-08-25 Steve         Bullock       New York  NY    town hall 
# … with 1 more variable: description <chr>

I then sorted the months by the last name “Harris” using the code below. In additon, I gave the count command to tally up all visits during that month (shown under the “n” column in “kamala_months”). I used the code:
events_month <- events%>% mutate(month(date))
Kamala_months <- events_month%>% filter(cand_lastname == “Harris”)%>% count(month = month(date))

# A tibble: 10 x 2
   month     n
   <dbl> <int>
 1     1     8
 2     2     3
 3     3     6
 4     4    12
 5     5     8
 6     6     8
 7     7     8
 8     8     5
 9    11     1
10    12     2

Finally, I created a bar graph which illustrated the month and number of time visited by Harris during the 2020 presidential campaign trail.

title: An Analysis On Financial Complaints
description: Financial complaints broken down by the top states.
contents:
Below find my analysis on financial complaints broken down by the top 5 states.
I began this analysis by downloading the data of financial complaints and selecting the data I wanted to analyze. I used the code:
topic <- select(complaints, sub_product)
topics_summed <- count(topic, sub_product)

                                  sub_product      n
1                                   Auto debt   1656
2                 CD (Certificate of Deposit)    503
3                       Check cashing service    101
4                            Checking account  16513
5                  Conventional home mortgage  13600
6                            Credit card debt  11647
7                      Credit repair services    405
8                            Credit reporting 253946
9                             Debt settlement     95
10               Domestic (US) money transfer   2105
11                  Federal student loan debt    346
12             Federal student loan servicing   2204
13                               FHA mortgage   3044
14                  Foreign currency exchange     63
15 General-purpose credit card or charge card  20329
16               General-purpose prepaid card   1388
17                                  Gift card     74
18                    Government benefit card   3357
19 Home equity loan or line of credit (HELOC)   1158
20                              I do not know  11228
21                           Installment loan   1589
22               International money transfer   1064
23                                      Lease   1030
24                                       Loan   5026
25                               Medical debt   6733
26                   Mobile or digital wallet   2894
27                                Money order    106
28                              Mortgage debt    725
29           Other banking product or service   2171

32                     Other type of mortgage   1345
33                                  Pawn loan     11

35                           Payday loan debt   1262
36                               Payroll card    120
37                    Personal line of credit    864
38                       Private student loan   1156
39                  Private student loan debt    419
40                  Refund anticipation check     84
41                           Reverse mortgage    190
42                            Savings account   1479
43                          Store credit card   3853
44                       Student prepaid card      7
45                                 Title loan    322
46        Traveler's check or cashier's check     82
47                                VA mortgage   1603
48                           Virtual currency    908

I then sorted the complaints by states and counted them up using the following code
state_complaints <- select(complaints, c(state, product))
state_summed <- count(state_complaints, state)

                                  state     n
1                                        9934
2                                    AA     9
3                                    AE    84
4                                    AK   358
5                                    AL  9840
6                                    AP    39
7                                    AR  6961

9                                    CA 46721
10                                   CO  3855

13                                   DE  1779

50                                   TX 44504
51 UNITED STATES MINOR OUTLYING ISLANDS    45

Finally, I placed the data in a plotly bar graph code and created the following bar graph with the top 5 states with the most financial complaints according to my data.

title: Welcome to Morgan Miller's Website
description: Welcome to my blog. Please explore my about page to learn more about me, and get to know my past analysis projects.
